storyInfo: Hildegard, having traveled to Lungmen looking for a solution to her monastery's financial woes, finds success. But in her spare time, finds herself musing on her connection to the world.

attributes.content: Our sister, Hildegard. Today, we see you off.
May the light extol your path forth, may piety and conviction be forever by your side.
The bells of Landen Monastery cross long through... hm? What?
*cough* The bells of Landen Monastery cross long through the years, tolling centuries of... Wine!?
Wh—Why has wine been left here? Where did... my Lord, don't tell me the old man snuck it in? Shh! Sshhh!
To be brief, may Landen's centuries of glory be with you! Now, Hildegard! Come here and help! Help us get the wine barrel open!
Hee-hee, we can't have a farewell without this, can we? Now, before the old man comes back! Cheers!
Ah... did I fall asleep?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Someone's knocking at the door... it's this late already!?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Good morning, Cleric Hildegard.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Good morning, or should I say good afternoon, Mr. Bison. It's been long since I laid on a bed. I seem to be somewhat remiss.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: It's been a long journey, I don't blame you. I came to confirm your travel itinerary today; hopefully I didn't disturb your rest?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: No worries at all. I thank all your efforts as well.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: You came from Laterano... such a far-off country, all the way to Lungmen. It can't have been easy, can it?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: It wasn't.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: This is my own first time so far from Laterano... Long-distance travel isn't as simple as admiring the scenery, it turns out.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Ha ha. Even seasoned Messengers still take every method they can to keep their moods level...
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: The life of a Messenger must be tough.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: So, Miss Hildegard, was last night's accommodation to your liking?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Mm-hm. It's a stone's throw from the city center, and very cheaply priced. You've got some keen insight.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: You don't need to worry about expenses, actually. MountainDash Logistics will reimburse the costs of your time in Lungmen.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: No, as a representative of Landen Monastery, I can't depend on the wealth of others. Forgive me for that.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: What's more, I'm on this mission precisely to address the many problems besetting the Monastery. I could never partake excessively of others' friendship on their land, all while indulging myself.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I see... your mindset really is admirable.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: A compulsory lesson, and nothing more.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Your meeting with Eurill is set for tomorrow evening. May I ask what your plans are for today?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Um... I'll take a small walk around the area. It's my first time in Yan, after all.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Will you require a tour guide or entourage to be arranged, then?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Ah, no. I'd like to look about myself. I'm just satisfying my own curiosity, that's all; I wouldn't like to trouble you all.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Alright... then I won't keep bothering you.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Thank you for your understanding.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: If I may be so bold as to ask, Mr. Eurill is your father, is he not?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hm? Uh, he is. What about it?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: No, forgive me. It's just that I've noticed you treat him wholly as if he's your boss while you're on the job, Mr. Bison...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Uh-huh. If I always rely on my relationship with the old man, how could I ever surpass him?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Hahah, I see you're someone of great ambitions too, then, Mr. Bison.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hardly. If it hadn't come up with you, Cleric Hildegard, I wouldn't even talk about anything like it with a client.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Well, I won't bother you any further...
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: But if you have any spare time, I'd like to hear your stories about Laterano. Just as you're curious about Lungmen, I... think about that place a lot.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: But of course.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Alright. I wish you a pleasant day.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Lungmen, then.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I don't really have any travel funds, but... I suppose I'll wander around some.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: After all, 'opportunity and faith alike dwell in markets and bells.'
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Your dad's too set in his ways! This is Lungmen, come on!
attributes.name: Male Lungmenite

attributes.content: But it's a craft our old place passed down from generation to generation...
attributes.name: Female Lungmenite

attributes.content: Look at the age we're in now! How's manual labor going to make any money?
attributes.name: Male Lungmenite

attributes.content: That's true. That's something my dad needs to be talked over for.
attributes.name: Female Lungmenite

attributes.content: What number were we in the queue again?
attributes.name: Male Lungmenite

attributes.content: Number 21. It'll be us pretty soon now. Why's this dessert shop so crowded...
attributes.name: Female Lungmenite

attributes.content: I'm number 31.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: So sweet...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Uh... a-are you the visitor from Laterano?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Hm? Do you know of me?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Uh, yes, actually, for certain reasons my house is currently uninhabitable, so the L.G.D. gave me a residence at the same inn as you... erm, I'm actually right across from you...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: So I see... what a coincidence, then.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Ah, where are my manners? I should introduce myself first. I come from Laterano's Landen Monastery. Please, call me Hildegard. You might be?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Y-Y-You don't need to be all polite to me, I'm just an average engineer... engineer, codename Snowsant...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Actually, um, why isn't a person of your status living in a more high-class apartment instead?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Ahahah... I have a few troubles, too, but it's moreso to remind myself. You needn't be so modest with me, either. I'm just touring around right now, that's all.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Here. Would you like some?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Are these... cakes?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: I'd noticed they were famous, and so I bought two extra, but I hadn't imagined the flavor would be so intense.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: That said, if such things can gain widespread popularity, then perhaps the goods the Monastery can offer may not suit Lungmen...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Are you sure you can give me these?!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Eh? Ah, by all means.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Th... thank you...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: (She's just like a hungry little cystybeast...) Ahem. Do eat a little slower.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Snowsant, was it? Would you be able to accompany me for a while longer?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Nmp, *sigh*. Of... Of course, Ma'am! I'm on vacation today!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: D—Don't shout 'Ma'am' like that; I feel a little bad now...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I hadn't noticed, but it's already evening now.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The days without hearing the bells...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Miss Hildegard, is something wrong?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Ah. Nothing. I just feel like the time passes so fast.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: In the end, today was a day off, and the traffic jams were all so bad. We just wandered around Lungmen city center a little and it's already dark now.
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Snowsant, what kind of place is Columbia, I wonder?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Huh? Let me think... uh, everything's so bright all the time, it's really technological, and...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: A little inhuman...?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: O-Of course, I only stayed in the research institute! To be clear, I never went more than two kilometers from my workplace!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Ohh, that tiny little back-and-forth life... I feel queasy...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Hahah... forget I mentioned it. Don't force yourself.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Sigh.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Miss Hildegard, what kind of... place is Landen Monastery? I've only heard about the Notarial Hall before...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: ...Bread.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Bread?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: It's ancient, a convent situated amongst the wheat fields and hills.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: It was originally for the training of Apostolic warriors. Its greatest difference from the Notarial Hall and the Apostolic Knights is that Landen Monastery accepts people from countries the world over.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Gulp. But..?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: But these last few years have been too peaceful! The Notarial Hall mopped up every last bit of our work! We didn't get a single new disciple this year! The old man's cohort refuses any grants on the grounds of teaching the Monastery to be self-reliant!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: It's about to go bankrupt. The time-honored Landen Monastery is about to go BANKRUPT because of its financial issues!!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Miss Hildegard, should you say 'bankrupt' for a monastery...?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: It's the closest word there is. Take it or leave it.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: And that's why you left Laterano, Miss Hildegard?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: There always has to be a way. Fortunately, the Monastery's reputation aside, people might not think we're much more than ornamental, but at the very least, we still have our grand wheat field...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I've troubled you enough for today, Snowsant.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: N-No problem! I didn't have any other plans for today anyway...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: I'm in Room 152! If there's anything else you need, Miss, you can come to me... Until my house is done being cleaned up, I'll be living here the whole time!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Ah, Cleric Hildegard, welcome.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Mr. Eurill, the privilege is mine.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Not at all. Loosen up, Cleric Hildegard, we're not too fond of overly formal meetings in our corporate culture.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Alright, then...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: So. Regarding the business terms, coming from Landen Monastery to Lungmen—
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: You're impressive. You had everything planned and prepared well in advance. Today was actually just to tell me about it all, wasn't it?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Nonsense.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Truly perfect. With my current insight alone, I have no way to compare to you in terms of Messenger-related work.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hah hah hah, it's my honor to get the seal of approval from a Laterano monastery cleric.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Mr. Eurill, forgive me for being so bold, but I'd like to ask you a few personal questions.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Why choose Landen Monastery?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: If a company with the heft of MountainDash Logistics seeks to open Messenger channels and refine its procedures...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Nonsense. We're deeply honored to be able to cooperate with an establishment as long and storied as Landen Monastery.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: —Do you know what the limit of my logistics company's reach is?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: As proud as I am of MountainDash Logistics, it's got no footprint beyond Lungmen and the five cities of Yan around it.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: What about Ursus, or Victoria? Lungmen is a crucial outwards-facing hub for Yan, so shouldn't foreign...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Unlike what the average person on the street thinks, it's damned hard for a logistics company to operate anywhere outside of its country of registration.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Even with fully lawful transit, most civil logistics business still gets passed onto locally partnered Messenger orgs afterwards. Not a single country's so loose it'd let other nations' Messengers run free range on its own soil.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Of course... that's just 'over-the-table' modes of work, but we don't need to probe into any sort of gray area right about now. Don't you mind it.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: I see, then...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: It's exactly as you say. For the stable setup of all kinds of information and transport hub links, the costs are—yes—not at all proportional to the profits the Monastery's goods bring in.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Even the cost of setting up a single Catastrophe Messenger base station'd blow your socks off.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: However, this piece of business is a pathway connecting us to Laterano. I assume you understand what significance that holds.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: This is only one blueprint amongst the things I wish to do, and at the very end of this pathway, Messengers will be able to overturn the barriers of culture and race. We can, with our own two hands, reach across this whole world.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: I know, for all sorts of reasons, that in all probability this wouldn't come about. Race, culture, history, and from time to time Catastrophes adding to the mix.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Innumerous factors roiling around our strip of world have ensured the countries can't pull together as one.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Perhaps we must weather war, withstand Catastrophe. Perhaps this plan fundamentally cannot have a smooth ride within this split-up, estranged world of ours—
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: But that does not stand to forbid... the existence of bridges.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: That being the case, we should try to part the great waves first.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: By certain means, I've come to notice... the Apostle, the one and only, seems pretty open to this kind of thought exercise. Because of that, perhaps Laterano is our first step of a sorts in testing this new direction.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Cleric Hildegard?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: No, sorry, I just never thought I'd be able to hear such things...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Does your son know about this, erm, magnificent plan of yours?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Of course he doesn't. He still needs to polish himself. As I've said before, this project cannot be built in a day. I'm not the kind of person who rigs up bridges by his own hands. Maybe he is. Maybe, or maybe he isn't.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: But he's my son, and that's enough.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Landen Monastery will assuredly find it a valuable experience, working in conjunction with your firm.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The honor is all mine, Cleric Hildegard.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: To tell the truth, Mr. Eurill, my own way of thinking is very simplistic. I adore my convent, and I believe the exemplary culture of Landen Monastery deserves to continue on.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: And so, I pray this will not spell its end.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: In comparison to your hopes, our motives may seem somewhat self-centered now.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Absolutely not, Cleric Hildegard. It's no small thing, wholeheartedly taking in and cherishing the homeland you adore.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: —And you don't need to worry if this'll bring the Monastery much trouble. Landen Monastery stands only as Landen Monastery, nothing more.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Heheh, I didn't mean it like that. You have a lot on your mind, Mr. Eurill.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Nonsense. I should say that to you, Cleric Hildegard. Back when I was your age, I sure couldn't keep my head cool like yours.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: It's gotten pretty late. We'll be getting a dinner party together for you tomorrow, Cleric Hildegard. Before that, you get some good shuteye.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Well, that went smoothly. What a mighty fellow.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Ugh, it feels like it's nothing to do with me now...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Just what can I do myself?
If only I knew.
Find some work? But how would I do that any faster...
Wh—What... what's happening?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Why does it turn out like this every time...?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Ya ain't used to it yet?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Used to becoming the focus of everyone's attention because of some unexpected explosion while we're on the way to a job?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Slow down... I see him now! Thief! Get'cher behind back here!
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Oh, wow... is this really how you catch a thief...? I wonder what they stole that made it so serious...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Who is it?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: It's me!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Come in!
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Ah... I didn't disturb your rest, did I?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Not at all. Is something the matter?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: It, it's just, um, I don't really know w-w-what to do on my own, because yesterday around this time I had my Miniature Cleaning Drone No. 23 to upgrade...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Ah, um, yes, that's right, since I wanted to try out an even simpler Originium circuit, but in the end I set the curtains on fire... and, um...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: *whimper*... I bought insurance... but now my card's balance is...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: A—Alright, it's okay, you actually came at a good time. Do you recognize those people down there?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Down? Speaking of, it was really loud just now...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Texas! They went your way.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: On 'em!
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Whoaaa... it's, it's all the Penguin Logistics girls...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Ah. I think I've heard that name before.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Is it in their nature to... er, drift across the road to head off a car?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Uh, um, this happens often.
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: It happens often, does it...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Do you know their names?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Huh? Um, I do actually see a lot of them, for work...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: The super handsome wolf who's driving, that's Texas. The really energetic lady chasing people with the hammer, she's Croissant...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: (Neither seem like real names. Maybe I ought to start thinking too...)
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Ah, the cute lady who's trying to intervene right now is Sora... she used to be a really famous idol, but I'm guessing monasteries don't really hear about that stuff?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: An idol?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Yep, um, singer, star, that sort of idea.
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: A star...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The Monastery has its fair share of disciplines and taboos, but they aren't all that strict... at least, in the past few years, they haven't been.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: What does it feel like, to be a star?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I'd like to know too...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Ah, the inn's intercity net TV should have recordings of her concerts available to broadcast. Why not see for yourself...?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: The night's still young, after all.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Th, then let's take a look... uh... you have to pay... oh? This one's a free program...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Truthfully, I've thought about it before.
Thought about the world outside, if it was nothing like I'd ever seen before.
Ah, it's so late already—
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Zzz... zzz...
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Oh my...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: My apologies... good night, Snowsant.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Yaawwn—
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Watching it actually woke me up...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: TV, huh. The Monastery, I think, had a TV of its own...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Through such a little rectangle, you can see across the whole world...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: ...An idol...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: No-no-no-what in Heaven's name am I thinking—
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: A Kazimierz Knight. That might not be too bad either... but those Majors always make you feel like something's off... if I have the chance, I should go see one.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Leithanien's Casters seem very well-regarded. I remember Angelica going off to Leithanien after she'd finished with us. I think she was pursuing further study at a music conservatory...?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Sigh.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The stars in the sky are so clear tonight.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The poets give the stars their words, the vagrants bare their million thoughts to the night. And me, I've already decided which star up there's gonna have my name.
Evenin', sister.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: A—And you are?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Oh, I saw you comin' outta my bar a minute ago. I was wrappin' up a little accident, see.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Er... Isn't that MountainDash Logistics's...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Eurill? Dumbass cow bought it and won't give it back, but you know what I'm sayin', I'm still that place's one and only bartender! I'm its soul!
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Oh... hold up, hold up.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: What? A fake? You got duped?
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Then what're you waitin' for? Give their boat some fireworks! Yeah! That's what I said! What? 'course you gotta take me! What, you gonna leave me out?!
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: (No matter what this is, it has to be illegal, right—?!)
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: What did Eurill tell you?
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Why would I—
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Nah, I know. Could only be gettin' some more hands on board, lookin' for a way out. Peace be to him.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: It's a helluva world, shorty.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Why are you just—
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But the way I see it now, you gotta think a little bigger.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Don't you worry, you're pretty easy on the eyes. My eyes. Even Paul Landen, handsome ass. I like it when he puts down his gun and picks up a pen!
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Found them, boss.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Wait—
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Waiting's a sucker's game! We got fools to huck in the river!
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Paul Landen... the founder of the Monastery? What in the world was that strange little person trying...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: What a brave new world.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Mr. Eurill, you'll have to forgive my manners, but before I leave Lungmen, there's something I must ask you.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: By all means.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Why are you always in this bar?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hah hah hah... I only just bought this place out from an acquaintance of mine. I quite fancy the atmosphere. It's not loud, it's not dirty, it's well-lit and strikes a vivid look.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Bars don't usually come like this, at least not in Lungmen. I don't know about Laterano... but I guess you probably don't see clerics in bars.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: It's not the total truth. Sundays in the convent's dormitories fundamentally aren't that different from a bar.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hah hah, I think I understand now, why it is you and I can chat.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: But the most important thing is, at some point, all of a sudden, I became very enamored with this bar's name—
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: —'The Ends of the Earth.'
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: At this very moment, we're at 'The Ends of the Earth.'
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: ...I see, then.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Well, to this project bringing the ideal to fruition. Cheers.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Cheers.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: When are you setting off?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: The plan was for tomorrow morning at nine.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Oh... did the plan change?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: My mind changed.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Then regardless of what you're planning to do, will you need the assistance of our Messengers?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: I won't. I didn't leave the Monastery this time just for one or two odds and ends, after all.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: What's more important is, I'm going to find where I can expand on my own faith.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I see. You've reached a conclusion?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I'm hard-pressed to say it's a conclusion...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: I'd love to see more of it. The world out there is... truthfully, a little more fascinating than I'd thought.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Now that's an answer with some youthful pep. I've got a small question too, and I'd like to seek a cleric's guidance.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: You flatter me. Please, ask away.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Do you think... that our project, even in the future, will truly be given others' recognition? Do you think the other voices of Laterano might stand on the other side to us?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: The value of things shouldn't be decided prior to their coming. At the very least, we can choose to have some respect for all things and all creatures.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Is that a principle of the Monastery, too?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Just Laterano nature. For that matter, Mr. Eurill, did you just want to test the present attitude of Landen Monastery?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Nonsense. I'm just curious what kind of heart my current collaborators bring to their work.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Obviously, I wouldn't doubt my own business. Thing is, once some things get beyond the scope of business, I have to start minding what other people think.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: How do you see it?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Landen Monastery tells a fable.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: They say, in a certain church in Laterano, there was a vast mural, depicting a story of heroes in ancient times, fighting for their faith.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Artists, from all over, all came to examine this mural. Some praised, some criticized, some chose to keep a rational quiet.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: —Then, from a small little quarter of Leithanien, came an upstart.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: The upstart was bloated, and unwilling to climb the church's stairs, thereupon he gazed at the church's window from afar. Through that window, he sighted a single deformed, vile beast in the artwork.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: And immediately, this businessman began to slander the mural, first saying that the hallowed and pure Laterano had produced such repulsive paintings, downright immoral.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Soon after, he spoke that even this single vile beast had a great many imperfections in the art.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Vile beast?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Little did he realize that what he saw was not a vile beast in the mural, but a church ornament and a candleholder's silhouette, which by misfortune had given him such a mistaken impression.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: He couldn't even step into the grand church, yet dismantling what he saw in that superficial fragment, he came to an insight more superficial still.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Where do you think the problem arose from?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: —Arrogance, and prejudice.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: So this fable is named 'La Bestia Superba.' If you should ask 'why did the church construct so high of a staircase?', that was indeed an arrogance in itself.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: What you want to do—that is to shatter all arrogance, or at the least, between every country, every land, every race's inharmonious arrogances, find a path, through the life mission of a Messenger.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: And between those, you even include the very arrogance of nature and life itself—Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: In realistic terms, I feel it will be very hard.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Someone's always got to be that stepping stone.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: This has eased my heart some.  When we're meant to talk money, we should talk it. But here, with you, Mr. Eurill, we're certainly talking of more than just money...
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: We're talking of quite a fair project. I feel a deep admiration for your ability to run things.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hah hah hah, if that's how you think, then I'm completely and utterly relieved.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: If you have the chance, why not take that son of mine on a trip to Laterano.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: But of course.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: After all, ever since he came into contact with Mostima, I can see in his eyes, his idea of a 'Messenger' has grown a lot less narrow. Not bad—hm? What's that look for?
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: I feel like I've heard a name I can't quite let pass.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Oh? Was she that famous? I thought her reputation was pretty internal to the Messenger biz.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Well, ever since she was exiled, I haven't heard more about her, really.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Sankta can live very good lives wherever they are. After all, they're Sankta.
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Hah hah, true words.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Right, Emperor wanted me to give you this.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: Um? Emperor?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: A very tenacious guy. He does everything off-script, but make no mistake, he's reliable.
attributes.name: Eurill

attributes.content: This is... a contact address? Is this a... company?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Rho... Rhodes Island... Is that how you read it?
attributes.name: Hildegard

attributes.content: Ah... once in a while, you trust Emperor's taste in associates. And you can trust me, they and this strip of world are marvelous one and the same.
attributes.name: Eurill
